column1: DataFrame Functions:
pd.DataFrame(): Creates a new DataFrame from various inputs like arrays
pd.concat(): Concatenates DataFrames along a specified axis.
pd.merge(): Merges two DataFrames based on a common column or index.
pd.pivot_table(): Creates a pivot table from a DataFrame.
pd.melt(): Unpivots a DataFrame from wide to long format.
pd.crosstab(): Computes a cross-tabulation table.
DataFrame Methods:
Indexing and Selection:
.loc[]: Accesses a group of rows and columns by label(s).
.iloc[]: Accesses a group of rows and columns by integer position(s).
.at[]: Accesses a single value using label(s).
.iat[]: Accesses a single value using integer position(s).
.head(n): Returns the first n rows of the DataFrame.
.tail(n): Returns the last n rows of the DataFrame.
Data Cleaning and Manipulation:
.drop(): Removes specified rows or columns.
.fillna(): Fills missing values with the given value.
.isna(): Returns a DataFrame of booleans indicating missing values.
.dropna(): Drops rows with missing values.
.sort_values(): Sorts the DataFrame by specified column(s).
.rename(): Renames columns or index.
Data Aggregation and Transformation:
.groupby(): Groups data based on a specified column or multiple columns.
.agg(): Applies an aggregation function to grouped data.
.apply(): Applies a function along the specified axis (rows or columns).
.transform(): Applies a function to grouped data and broadcasts the results.
Data Visualization:
.plot(): Generates various types of plots using Matplotlib or another backend.
DataFrame Attributes:
.index: The row labels of the DataFrame.
.columns: The column labels of the DataFrame.
.shape: Tuple representing the dimensions (rows
.dtypes: Returns a Series with the data type of each column.
.values: Numpy representation of the DataFrame's data.
.size: Number of elements in the DataFrame.
.empty: True if DataFrame is empty.
DataFrame Methods:
Data Summarization:
.sum(): Computes the sum of values for each column.
.mean(): Computes the mean of values for each column.
.median(): Computes the median of values for each column.
.min()
column2: .max(): Computes the minimum and maximum values for each column.

column1: .count(): Counts non-null values for each column.
.value_counts(): Returns a Series of unique values and their counts.
Data Reshaping:
.pivot(): Reshapes data from long to wide format using unique values as columns.
.stack(): Pivots the columns into rows
.unstack(): Pivots the index levels into columns.
Data Merging and Joining:
.join(): Joins two DataFrames on their indexes.
.concat(): Concatenates DataFrames along a specified axis.
.merge(): Merges DataFrames based on common columns or indexes.
Data Aggregation and Grouping:
.groupby(): Groups data based on a specified column or multiple columns.
.agg(): Applies multiple aggregation functions to grouped data.
.pivot_table(): Creates a pivot table from a DataFrame.
Data Cleaning and Transformation:
.applymap(): Applies a function element-wise to the entire DataFrame.
.map()
column2: .replace(): Applies mapping or replacement to specific columns.
